results.title: LT: Year 11
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.

results.title: Appeal
results.brief_description:
Edith lives alone with her cat, unhappy with her looks and her life, when media influence and an accident involving a peeler set her on a path to transform her body image. Initial improvement to Edith’s wellbeing is tragically compromised by obsession.

Film explores issues surrounding self image and eating disorders.

This work was created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT.

results.title: The Flycycle
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
An older, wiser man recalls his memories as a youth observing the fantastic efforts of his uncle to achieve a new form of flight.
results.description:

results.title: Ropes
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
A bittersweet allegory of love and desire set in a city strung together by tightropes
